item.title: By: Brent Lagerman
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description: it's set up to remove itself when the page loads, can you open your console log and let me know if it's showing you any errors. In chrome use the keyboard shortcut Command + Option + J (Mac) or Control + Shift + J (Windows/Linux). Also what's the URL?
item.content:encoded: it’s set up to remove itself when the page loads, can you open your console log and let me know if it’s showing you any errors. In chrome use the keyboard shortcut Command + Option + J (Mac) or Control + Shift + J (Windows/Linux). Also what’s the URL?

item.title: By: Brent Lagerman
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description: hey Scott, sorry I've had my head down for a while re-designing our site. I just saw these comments, did you get it working? I wasn't seeing it on your site.
item.content:encoded: hey Scott, sorry I’ve had my head down for a while re-designing our site. I just saw these comments, did you get it working? I wasn’t seeing it on your site.

item.title: By: Scott
item.dc:creator: Scott
item.description:
Just wanted to stop by and say Thanks again for this script! It really saved the site.
It's a soft launch, in case you wanted to check it out:
http://allexteriorcs.com/

item.title: By: Scott
item.dc:creator: Scott
item.description:
GOT IT!
Uncaught ReferenceError: jQuery is not defined
dropped modernize, moved jquery library above document ready script and Presto!
Thanks for this!
item.content:encoded:
GOT IT!

Uncaught ReferenceError: jQuery is not defined

dropped modernize, moved jquery library above document ready script and Presto!

Thanks for this!

item.title: By: Scott
item.dc:creator: Scott
item.description:
This is ALMOST exactly what I've been looking for. I'm running a WP site using the Avada Theme with the LayerSlider and a transparent background. I was having trouble with a split second of load time and all the content being jammed up to the top of the page.
I added modernizr.min.js in the head, put the document ready script in the head as well, put the js class within the html element, added the preloader div right below the body, added the css, and uploaded the loading gif.
Everything Looks Great! Just what i was looking for, except the loading gif won't go away after the page finishes loading... : (
Can you think of anything I'm forgetting? Any help would be greatly appreciated.
item.content:encoded:
This is ALMOST exactly what I’ve been looking for. I’m running a WP site using the Avada Theme with the LayerSlider and a transparent background. I was having trouble with a split second of load time and all the content being jammed up to the top of the page.

I added modernizr.min.js in the head, put the document ready script in the head as well, put the js class within the html element, added the preloader div right below the body, added the css, and uploaded the loading gif.

Everything Looks Great! Just what i was looking for, except the loading gif won’t go away after the page finishes loading… : (

Can you think of anything I’m forgetting? Any help would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: By: Arya
item.dc:creator: Arya
item.content:encoded:
Your website is fantastic in style way,add these css code to change the style of your scrollbar(in chrome only,but you can also make it in for other browsers,i have forgotten):

/*chrome scroll*/

::-webkit-scrollbar { width: 10px; height: 10px; }

::-webkit-scrollbar-track { background-color: transparent;}

::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb {height: 1px;background-color:#ccc;border-radius: 1px;}

::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb:hover {background-color:#bbb;}

::-webkit-scrollbar-corner { background-color: #}}

::-webkit-resizer { background-color: #999;}
